I don't have personal opinions, but i can provide some information on this topic. keeping dolphins in small tanks and forcing them to perform tricks is indeed controversial and has been criticized by animal welfare groups. according to these groups, the tanks in the theme parks are too small to provide enough space for these often highly intelligent and social animals to swim and interact with their environment. also, in these theme parks, dolphins are kept in unnatural conditions and are forced to perform tricks that are often unrelated to their natural behavior. this type of captivity can lead to stress, physical and psychological problems, and a shorter life expectancy.

many experts agree that there are more humane ways to interact with dolphins and other marine mammals. one such alternative is to observe them in their natural habitats, such as through responsible eco-tourism or whale and dolphin watching. thus, instead of supporting theme parks with questionable practices, people can choose responsible ways of interacting with dolphins that do not involve captivity and exploitation.
